_data.title: creating a widget

children.value: create a widget class that extends the \Elementor\Widget_Base
overwrite some methode like this exemple
// return a widget name that will be used in the code
// return the widget title that will be displayed as the widget label
// you can use any of the eicon or font-awesome icons, simply return the class name as a string
// set the category of the widget
//return the category name as a string
// define which controls (setting fields) your widget will have
// render the code and generate the final HTML on the frontend using PHP
// render the editor output to generate the live preview using a Backbone JavaScript template
require the class file and add this file to init_widgets method in the plugin-name.php file
add the widget controls using the _register_controls() method.
in this case, we only have one control which is a simple URL input:
in this exemple we implement our render() method which takes the URL the user inputs in the above URL control and get the oEmbed content to display using the native wp_oembed_get() function
this is a final code exemple form the official elementor documentation

/**
 * Elementor oEmbed Widget.
 *
 * Elementor widget that inserts an embbedable content into the page, from any given URL.
 *
 *

/**

     *

     * Get widget title.

     * Retrieve oEmbed widget title.
     *
     *

/**
     * Get widget icon.
     *
     * Retrieve oEmbed widget icon.
     *
     *

/**
     * Get widget categories.
     *
     * Retrieve the list of categories the oEmbed widget belongs to.
     *
     *

/**
     * Register oEmbed widget controls.
     *
     * Adds different input fields to allow the user to change and customize the widget settings.
     *
     *

/**
     * Render oEmbed widget output on the frontend.

     * Written in PHP and used to generate the final HTML.
     *

_data.title: Initial configuration

children.value: create a folder in the plugin directory,
create a file in the same name of this plugin directory
add this code to the plugin-name.php

/**
 * Plugin Name:       My custom elementor plugin
 * Plugin URI:        https://example.com/plugins/the-basics/
 * Description:       Handle the basics with this plugin.
 * Version:           1.10.3
 * Requires at least: 5.2
 * Requires PHP:      7.2
 * Author:            John Smith
 * Author URI:        https://author.example.com/
 * License:           GPL v2 or later
 * License URI:       https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.html
 * Text Domain:       my-basics-plugin
 * Domain Path:       /languages
 */

/*
{Plugin Name} is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
the Free Software Foundation, either version 2 of the License, or
any later version.

{Plugin Name} is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
along with {Plugin Name}. If not, see {URI to Plugin License}.
*/
for security reason, create an index.php inside the plugin-name directory
and edit the Elementor_Test_Extension to the name you like

_data.title: Register Widget Controls

children.value: Sections are created using two methods, the start_controls_section() method which creates a new section and the end_controls_section() method to close the section.
New controls are added using the add_control() method
for more control type: visite this elementor official documentation:
- use start_popover() method and the end_popover() method.

_data.title: Register style and script

children.value: add the elementor/frontend/after_enqueue_styleselementor/frontend/after_enqueue_styles to the init fuction
create a fucntion to register all the style
add the elementor/frontend/after_register_scriptselementor/frontend/after_register_scripts action to the init method and create a fuction to register all the script
NB: the style and script is not enquee yet, it was been registered

_data.title: Widget category

children.value: create a widget class and extends the \Elementor\Widget_Base class
add the elementor/elements/categories_registered to the init function
and add a function with this code
